History & Physical Report
7/ 29 / 2020: Office Visit - Atrial fibrillation, currently in sinus rhythm (Z86.79), Dyslipidemia (E78.5), Neurogenic syncope (R55),
Acute pleuropericarditis (I 30.9), Ramsay Hunt syndrome, Gastroesophageal reflux disease without esophagitis (K21.9)
(Sanjaya Khanal, MD)
Kathryn R Mchale
7/29/ 2020 12:15 PM
Location: Antelope Valley Cardiology Associates
Patient # : 53060
DOB: 6/ 19/1938
Married / Language: English / Race: White
Female
History of Present I llness (Sanjaya Khanal MD; 7/29/2020 12:44 PM)
The patient is a 82 year old female presenting to discuss diagnostic procedure results. The patient had an exteneded 14 day ECG. The diagnostic
test was performed on - Date: (10/ 25/2019). Labs done on 07/23/2020. Patient generally feels well with no new symptoms since last visit.
Patient specifically denies chest pain, shortness of breath, orthopnea, edema, palpitations, or lightheadedness. she does describe more easy
fatigability with exertion.
Additional reasons for visit:
Transition into care is described as the following:
Note for "Transition into care": To continue cardiac care
Problem List/Past Medical (Neidine Casas, MA; 7/29/ 2020 12:17 PM)
Acute pleuropericarditis (I30.9) in 2009
Ramsay Hunt syndrome (053.11) with chronic vertigo
Dyslipidemia (E78.5) 
Atrial fibrillation, currently in sinus rhythm (Z86.79) h/o paroxysmal lone A-fib. Normal LV function. Holter monitor on 4/4/2017 showed sinus
rhythm with occasional PACs and PVCs. eechocardiogram on 10/4/2018 shows LVEF of 65%.
Neurogenic syncope (R55) Likely vasovagal. CT head was negative at PRMC. Holter 3/13 was unremarkable. Echo nomral LVEF 65%. Event
monitor 4/13 normal.
Gastroesophageal reflux disease without esophagitis (K21.9) 
Ramsay Hunt syndrome [04/ 18/2018]: with chronic vertigo
Medication History (Neidine Casas, MA; 7/29/2020 12:23 PM)
Metoprolol Succinate ER (25MG Tablet ER 24HR, 1 (one) Oral qd, Taken starting 01/07/2020) Active.
Aspirin (81MG Tablet, Oral, Taken starting 10/18/ 2019) Active.
Rosuvastatin Calcium (5MG Tablet, ½ (one half) Tablet Oral daily, Taken starting 07/29/2020) Active. (stop simvastatin)
Protonix (40MG Tablet DR, Oral) Active.
Meclizine HCl (12.5MG Tablet, Oral prn) Active.
Multi Vitamin/ Minerals (1 tab Oral qd) Active.
Lysine HCl (1000MG Tablet, Oral qd) Active.
Calcium-Magnesium (500-250MG Tablet, Oral bid) Active.
Glucosamine Chondr 1500 Complx (Oral qd) Active.
Medications Reconciled 
Allergies (Neidine Casas, MA; 7/29/2020 12:17 PM)
Penicillins 
Social History (Neidine Casas, MA; 7/29/202

0 PM)
Patient was born in 1938. She is married and speaks English. Her race is White. Patient has no history of any chronic illness. Patient does not smoke or drink alcohol. Patient does not have any significant family history. Patient does not have any significant past medical history. Patient does not have any current medical problems. Patient does not have any current symptoms.
Physical Examination (Neidine Casas, MA; 7/29/2020 12:18 PM)
Appearance: Alert and oriented. Vitals: Temperature: 97.9 F, HR: 70 BPM, Blood Pressure: 139/94 mmHg, Respiration: 20 breaths/min, O2 sat: 99% on room air.
Musculoskeletal: No abnormalities. Cardiac: Regular rhythm, regular apex beat. No peripheral edema.
Abdominal: No abnormalities. Neurologic: Alert and oriented, normal mentation. No signs of focal neurologic deficit. No signs of vertigo.
Psy
